de.systemagmbh.tools.util
Class CSysCharSeparatedString

java.lang.Object
  de.systemagmbh.tools.util.CSysCharSeparatedString
public final class CSysCharSeparatedString
extends Object

Utility class for handling Strings that have a delimiter. The radix for level operations is '0' NOT '1'.

Version:
$Revision: 1.5 $
Author:
Udo Friedrich, Christian Wohanka

CSysCharSeparatedString

public CSysCharSeparatedString(String s,
                               String sep)
Creates a new instance of a CSysCharSeparatedString.

Parameters:
s - A separated string. This string is parsed.
sep - The character that is used as separator.
Method Detail

addLevel

public void addLevel(String str)
              throws StringIndexOutOfBoundsException
Adds a String as new level at the end of this separated string.

Parameters:
str - String to be added
Throws:
StringIndexOutOfBoundsException - if this operation will exceed maxLength.

setLevel

public void setLevel(int level,
                     String str)
              throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException,
                     StringIndexOutOfBoundsException
Set the element at the specified level.

Parameters:
level - The level to be set. If the predecessor levels do not exist they are created. (Levels start with 0!)
str - The string to be set.
Throws:
StringIndexOutOfBoundsException - if this operation will exceed maxLength.
ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if level is negative.

addLevels

public void addLevels(String str)
               throws StringIndexOutOfBoundsException
Add some elements to the end of this separated string.

Parameters:
str - A separated string. This string is parsed.
Throws:
StringIndexOutOfBoundsException - if this operation will exceed maxLength.

setLevels

public void setLevels(int level,
                      String str)
               throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException,
                      StringIndexOutOfBoundsException
Set some elements beginning at the specified level.

Parameters:
level - The level to start setting. (Levels start with 0!)
str - A separated string. This string is parsed.
Throws:
StringIndexOutOfBoundsException - if this operation will exceed maxLength.
ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if level is negative.

removeLevels

public void removeLevels(int level)
Remove all levels starting at the given level (radix 0). E.g. removeLevels(4) keeps the first 4 levels (levels 0 to 3).

Parameters:
level - The first level that is removed.

setMaxLength

public void setMaxLength(int length)
Set the maximum number of levels (radix 1). Levels bigger than this value are removed.

Parameters:
length - The maximum number of levels.

getMaxLength

public int getMaxLength()
Get the maximum number of levels (radix 1).

Returns:
the max length; if max length is not set -1 is returned.

setNoMaxLength

public void setNoMaxLength()
Disable the use of a maximum number of levels. (It is set to -1).

isMaxSet

public boolean isMaxSet()
Determine if maxLength is set or not.

Returns:
true if maxLength is set, false otherwise

setSeparator

public void setSeparator(String sep)
Set the separator.

Parameters:
sep - The new separator.

getSeparator

public String getSeparator()
Get the separator.

Returns:
the separator.

getLevel

public String getLevel(int level)
                throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
Get the String representation of the specified level.

Parameters:
level - the index of the level (radix 0).
Returns:
the value of the selected level
Throws:
ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if level is unknown.

getLevels

public String getLevels(int from,
                        int to)
                 throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
Get a String representation of the specified levels (radix 0).

Parameters:
from - The first level that is appended to the String.
to - The last level that is appended to the String.
Returns:
the Levels from 'from' to 'to' separated by the current set separator.
Throws:
ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if level is unknown.

getLevels

public String getLevels(int to)
Get a String representation from 0 up to the specified level (radix 0).

Parameters:
to - The last level that is appended to the String.
Returns:
the Levels from '0' to 'to' separated by the current set separator.

size

public int size()
Get the number of levels (sub-Strings) in the String.

Returns:
the number of levels (sub-Strings) in the String.

toString

public String toString()
Get the separated string.

Returns:
the separated string.

clone

public Object clone()
Create a clone of this object. Internally creates a new CSysCharSeparatedString with the result of toString() and getSeparator() as arguments.

Returns:
the clone of this object.
